marbleVERSE
Game Mechanics

In order to achieve it’s mission of promoting inclusivity and equality of opportunity Marbleverse games have to satisfy 3 main criteria:

  1. Simple rules. Anyone can easily understand the game and start playing.
  2. Game of chance. Assures equality of opportunity for everyone. Bot proof.
  3. Transparency. Excludes possibility of cheating. Insures integrity of the game.

Marbleverse idea was partly inspired by Netflix’s ‘Squid Game’ TV series. The marbles game (odd or even) featured in the show satisfies all the above criteria, making it a perfect fit for our project.

Rules

  • Each player is dealt 10 marbles at the start.
  • Objective of the game is to collect all of your opponent’s marbles.
  • The are only 2 players (i.e./ 'Hider' and 'Guesser').
  • Each round Hider has to pick an odd or even number from his stack => and Guesser has to do the same. Guesser's objective is to correctly predict if Hider's number is odd or even. He can wager any number he wants.
  • The prize is determined by the amount of marbles Guesser wagered.
  • Example: if the Guesser is correct, he collects the amount of marbles he wagered (e.g. Hider chose 3 marbles, Guesser picked 2 => Guesser collects 2 marbles).
  • If the Guesser is incorrect => Hider collects the amount of marbles wagered by the Guesser (e.g. Hider pick odd, Guesser wagers 8 and guesses incorrectly => loses 8 marbles).
  • If one of the Players is left with only 1 marble he can only assume the Guesser role.

Tournament format

Depending on the number of participants either a swiss system tournament, single-elimination tournament or a mix of both formats can be used.
